text: ( laughing )
( murmuring )

What ho, friends!
So you're awake.
Name's Horace.

Welcome to the hidden village
of Gardenton.

Gardenton?
That wasn't on any map.
We don't like drawing attention
to our little slice of paradise,
a place where every frog

is a highly skilled
horticulturalist.

Our plants are treated
with the love

- and respect they deserve.
- I don't believe it.

This place is full
of frogs just like me!

Oh? Do I sense
a fellow plantophile?
Guess who has two green thumbs

and loves the smell
of fertilizer? This guy!

Ooh! Ha-ha, clever, clever.
You do have the thumbs.

A village of horticulturalists?
Now we're talking.

Let's recruit them.
I'll take point.
I don't know, HP.

Does the resistance
really need plant people?

Yeah, the last village
made catapults.

I don't exactly
think horticulture--
I'm doing it!

Horace, my friend,
we've got a proposal,
and as head of this town

I think you're
going to want to hear it.

Oh, I'm afraid I'm not the head
of this community.

Oh? Well, can you take us
to your leader?

But of course.
Follow me to the greenhouse.

Say, Horace, have you seen
our snail? Or wagon?

They've been stored safely.
Now come along.
( laughing )
I'm officially creeped out.

Horace, this place
is incredible!
These parsnips are prodigious!
Coast orchids?

The balance of heat
and humidity must be perfect!

And this--
this is just a big cucumber.

I'm glad you like it,
but it wasn't always like this.

In fact, the land before you
used to be barren and lifeless.

But then he appeared,
and with his guidance

we were able to become one
with nature.

- ( snapping )
- Whoopsie daisy.
( screams )
( wailing )
Uh, it is insensitive if I say
this feels like an overreaction?
Please, guests, be careful.

These plants are as much members
of our community as we are.
My apologies, Horace.

Some of us
don't respect nature.
( wailing )
( whispered chanting )
Horace: We have arrived.

You must be the mayor.
Put 'er there.
Not a toucher, eh?

That's okay.
Not everyone is.
We'd be mighty obliged if you

and your green-fingered friends
joined our little resistance.

We've got hydroponics
like you wouldn't believe.
Uh, we also have casual Fridays
and bagel Tuesdays.
Kids, am I forgetting anything?

Hey, is this guy asleep
or some--
All: Oh, my frog!
( laughing maniacally )

Well, well, well,
if it isn't Hopediah Plantar.
Jeremy the beetle?
No. Up here, you idiot.
It's me, Apothecary Gary.
Apothecary Gary?
( groaning )
Zombies! Aah!

Ha-ha! Guess those muscles
were just for show.

I don't understand.
You're extinct.
I saw to it myself.

I nearly was,
but thanks to Jeremy here,

I was able to survive
and make my way
out of Wartwood.

Problem was,
I was weak and needed

to find a place
to regrow my strength.

It's a harsh world out there
for a little spore
and his beetle host.

Then I was taken in
by these folks,

and together we formed
a true symbiotic relationship.

You see, these frogs
wanted my spores

because it made them
better gardeners.

It wasn't mind control--
not this time, really.

And with this power, we turned
Gardenton into a paradise!

I've never had willing
subjects before,

And let me tell you,
it makes a big difference.

With Gary's spores,
we can feel the very needs
of the plants we cultivate.

We're one with nature.
It's perfect harmony.
All: Perfect harmony.
( whistles )

Well, this has all been
very educational.
Kids, now!
( screaming )
